website_summaries.verdict: Designed primarily for home use, such as hobbies, small repairs, and product assemblies. We appreciate its exceptionally low price point and its solid steel construction. If home users need a third hand for holding pieces, the Wilton is the right choice.
pros: Solid steel construction stronger than some higher-end vises
180-degree swivel base locks down with pins
Ideal for home projects, such as woodworking or light welding
cons: Small 4-inch jaws and opening width limit versatility
Arrives with heavy layer of preservative grease

customer_reviews.title: Mine broke.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this six months ago, installed it one month ago, and have used it maybe half a dozen times. A little flange that supports the jaw that moves has already broken off. It must have been while I was replacing the handle on a hatchet--either while driving the old handle out or while driving in the wedges. with the little flange broken off, the jaws no longer align. It will work well enough to make due with until I can afford better, I hope.
customer_reviews.author: MTFatBoy

customer_reviews.title: Dont Bother!
customer_reviews.text: The upper half cracked and broke off during use. The phone number on the warranty document is incorrect... for a completely different company!
customer_reviews.author: CGSLLC

customer_reviews.title: Good little bench vise for light duty work.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small bench vise for light duty to attach to my basement workbench, and I found it. It has proven to be plenty strong enough for hobby work without taking up too much space. I am also glad that it has an anvil block. No temptation to hammer on the jaws. The base can easily be removed to orient it the way you want. In my case, right on the corner without having a mounting bolt through the bench support.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Morton

customer_reviews.title: Wilton 11104 Wilton Bench Vise
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Wilton 1104 for my work shop. Purchase the Wilton 1106 for my heavy duty projects. The 1104 is perfect for my smaller projects. Also comes with a "Lifetime" Warranty.
customer_reviews.author: BILLY

customer_reviews.title: This was a replacement for a previous order. Both ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a previous order. Both broke in exactly the same place within a week. Not thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vice for light to medium duty work. I use it for assembling ARs and it's sturdy enough to install/remove muzzle brakes and even install and torque a barrel nut
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: First vise for the house.
customer_reviews.text: I went with this Vise as I am familiar with Wilton and their quality. This was a great price and easy to install. I was shocked but not surprised that it only allowed 3 bolts to bolt it down (which are not included).
customer_reviews.author: ZKM

customer_reviews.title: not hollow like the others
customer_reviews.text: Same price as the poorly made home depot version that broke. Comparitively, this one is heavy duty and full of features. There are two locks to prevent swivel on the base. It appears to be solid cast, not hollow like the others.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: If you want a Wilton vise that is made in the United States, you will need to spend over $500 which is about 10 times the price of the Chinese made vise. After a couple of whacks on the anvil, there are two hammer impressions on it now. I should expect this because Oriental steel manufacturing is pathetic compared to that of the United States and Japan, the countries that know how to forge steel.
customer_reviews.author: Town Destroyer

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty vice with cheap swivel bolt and handle. Broke right after I installed it. Now amazon is giving me the runaround on ups pickup and echange, they want me to drive all the way into town to return. They also are giving me the runaround on a replacement, they want me to return, wait for refund and order another? whats going on with Amazon?
customer_reviews.author: Larry Mays

customer_reviews.title: No problems at all, so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've tested it a little, I like the proportions, the size. It works smoothly. I have not tried to apply a really large amount o ftorgue to it yet, not sure we can expect a low priced vise to handle too mucg. But for this old woodworker, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Higher quality than expected & a lifetime warranty thru Wilton
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old "Harbor Freight" vice I had for years and I was a little concerned after reading the reviews, but this thing is miles better than that old POS I had! Much higher quality. Parts fit is good. Operation is smooth. The jaws are well aligned. I'm quite pleased with this vice. It may be 'made in China for Wilton' and not for some (and that's okay!) but for what I needed, it was tons better than what I had. Good product for the money AND it comes with a lifetime warranty via Wilton.
customer_reviews.author: Frog4aday

customer_reviews.title: Garage Vice
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a very sturdy vice for your home use this is the vice. Mounting instructions are very clear and the vice has been in use for about a week now and it holds very securely.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Figone

customer_reviews.title: Takes a licking and still ticking
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Holding steady. Bolted to my work bench. Been using for everything. Including beating on things. Jave soft grip inserts i bought also. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth your consideration
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews I was somewhat skeptical about purchasing this vise. I will say I'm glad I went forward with the purchase. After unboxing, I only had to do a minimal wipe down of the product. I installed three 3/8" lag bolts in the base a was ready to go. I have used it several times now with no issue and certainly no complaints. Would recommend this to any home user or DIY'er.
customer_reviews.author: SoutheastMC

customer_reviews.title: Its missing an attachment point.
customer_reviews.text: It only has 3 places to bolt it down! But after thinking about it why would you need to secure it properly as it cant take any abuse at all. See MTFatBoy February 19 2016.
customer_reviews.author: jon brown & karen houts

customer_reviews.title: Great bench vise for your home garage
customer_reviews.text: Wilton has a great reputation for making solid, quality vises...and, this one is no exception. The 4 inch was just what I need for all the little projects around the house - sharpening and grinding or just a second set of hands. Great vise for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Joel D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used the vise to work on my ARs and it serves its purpose well. Sturdy, durable and the right size for the type of work I use for.
customer_reviews.author: KC Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: While this bench vise lacks the smoothness of a high-end bench vise, it also lacks the price tag. Opening the jaws is a little jerky, closing is smooth enough. Happy with my purchase, can't imagine anything I'd be unable to do with this vise that a far more expensive model of the same size could do.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great but 3 mounting points.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Only issue I have, and I really hope it’s not an issue... is that it only has 3 mounting points for your work bench! I never saw that on the description and I would have probably picked something different. Looking forward to using it more though!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great for your shop
customer_reviews.text: So far it proves to be very sturdy. I dont do heavy work, but the metal looks and feels sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Marcello

customer_reviews.title: Great bench vice for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Great vice! Doesn't get 5 stars as the two lockdowns are the only things holding the vice to the base. There is no central swivel or bearing. To be expected for ~$35 though. Great for home applications, would not work under heavy duty applications.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a good vice!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I haven't purchased a bench vise since I work on our cars so much! This is a great vise. Used it to hold struts with no issues. If I remember, I'll post updates.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Very good vise
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews here, I purchased this vise. I do a lot of diy projects and sometimes need a third hand. One thing I really like about it is that it's made in the good old USA. That's rare these days. It's heavy too. I like that. It came well oiled and ready to go. Just had to bolt it down to the bench. I used some hefty lag screws on it. This baby isn't moving.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: This vise is the perfect compromise. It's like buying the cheapest model of ...
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a economic option is a vise. This vise is the perfect compromise. It's like buying the cheapest model of the nicest line of vises. You are really getting the best deal for the money. I use this vise weekly and it has stood up about a year of abuse without any part failures.
customer_reviews.author: Big_o_fish

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best!
customer_reviews.text: Wilton has been a quality producer of visas for a 100 years. Buy Wilton or Columbia always. NEVER waste money on a China built vice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent little vise
customer_reviews.text: It broke my Harbor Freight work bench when I was trying to torque down a vanos unit with a 36" breaker bar. I then mounted it to a sturdier surface and was successful. The little 'anvil' pad on there seems pretty decent too.
customer_reviews.author: Andy W.

customer_reviews.title: $ price
customer_reviews.text: for what a home garage machanic does this has been a great vise, getting on line was so much cheaper and the value is as good as any out there
customer_reviews.author: Becky Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Strong Vise At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great. Use for the money. Perfect for small jobs around the house
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: This was a great vise. I didn't have any vices before. Now I do! I used it to bend silverware to make handles for my kitchen cabinets. I beat on it pretty hard, but you can't tell I did.
customer_reviews.author: K. Yellen

customer_reviews.title: Can't pry on new vise like those a hundred years ago
customer_reviews.text: I broke the first one. Wilson promptly replaced my second one with very professional attitude.. Can't pry on new vise like those a hundred years ago. They just arent as touch
customer_reviews.author: W. Currie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this bench vise
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bench vise. It was simple to install on my work bench and I installed it in such a way that I can rotate it and get better angles with what I am working on depending on what tool I am using.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Florkowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Vise
customer_reviews.text: Excellent vise just wish I had bought a bigger size
customer_reviews.author: Mack57, industrial engineer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I paid to much but the product works as it should
customer_reviews.author: jsigur

customer_reviews.title: Good vise
customer_reviews.text: Nice little vise. Its sturdy enough for most home owner jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H.

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Had this vise for a year or so and use it a lot. No complaints. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Comtech75

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far this vise has been great. I have used it for light duty and also to put together an AR. It didn't not budge and works great and the third hand needed for many DIY projects that I do at home.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Yang

customer_reviews.title: Good size and quality bench vise
customer_reviews.text: Good size and quality bench vise. I use it occasionally for home projects. Not sure how it would stand up to everyday, heavy duty work.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for about 4 months. I mainly ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 4 months. I mainly use it for crimping 12v wiring. That was until a few days ago when the thing broke. Purely by hand and no leverage bar.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Hall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hobbyist vise
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described; quality workmanship; shipment arrived on time and the packaging was in good shape. Don't order this vise and expect it to be ready for a blacksmith or fabricator shop, it's meant for a hobbyist that needs secure clamping for small projects, and it fits that role to a "T".
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L.F. Von Euw

customer_reviews.title: Great little vise.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this little guy gets it done better than I could want. Rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Decent 4" Vise
customer_reviews.text: Wilton has a good reputation for quality vises. Overall first impressions are that the 4" vise is a great quality for the price. Opened the box and it was ready to go. I haven't gotten to beat it up just yet, but I'll let you know if it passes the torture test. Planning to use it for house projects and wood working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice small inexpensive vise
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice small inexpensive vise. I mounted it to a piece of plywood, then take it where I want and clamp it down with c-clamps, it works great. My 6'' Wilton vise stays mounted to work bench for the heavy jobs.
customer_reviews.author: H2Odog477

customer_reviews.title: Solid Vise from a Solid Company
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid vise. The quality you’d expect from a Wilton. No play in the screw at all. None of that sliding back and forth stuff. Great vise from a great company for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Wilton Brand Name
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for what I do with it. Also it is made out of pretty good stuff. My last one was a cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R Parson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The best vice I have seen for $30-$40. This is my second purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ara armen

customer_reviews.title: Put it on the workbench I just built in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Put it on the workbench I just built in the garage. The vise is definitely stronger than the workbench as I can hear the bench creaking and crackling under stress when I put ~80 pounds on anything clamped in the vise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ankenbruck

customer_reviews.title: If you need a vise for holding something, buy ...
customer_reviews.text: If you need a vise for holding something, buy this. It is crazy inexpensive for what you get. If you want to bend or hammer something, I would go bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Snazzy

customer_reviews.title: Great For a Gun Bench
customer_reviews.text: Nice bench vise at a good price with a jaw width wide enough to meet the needs of anyone building or working on firearms. Needed quite a bit of cleaning to get all of the grease off of everything...minus one star for that, but otherwise a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cloer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: The Wilton 4-inch Vise is perfect for my needs. It isn't too big or small and the Jaw aligns perfectly when shut. Like others have mentioned, there was initially alot of grease on the vice, however, you just need to wipe it off with a towel and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gastillo

customer_reviews.title: It is most important instrument
customer_reviews.text: It is very useful for doing any job to hold anything tightly to do jobs
customer_reviews.author: Rajkrishan Bedi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: OK, it says made in China right on it -- somehow the Wilton name makes it top-drawer China... feels solid, pivots nicely, certainly acceptably finshed and makes a great medium duty vise for my rolling work-bench. The modest price doesn't hurt for us weekend warriors, although I suspect the Pros (you know, the guys with the head-high SnapOn roll-chest ) will want something heavier...
customer_reviews.author: Geriatric Suthriner

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Holding up so far! Wilton is said to make a good vise. I hope it continues to hold up and be a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Dewees

customer_reviews.title: Great vise for the home shop
customer_reviews.text: Does what a vise is supposed to do. Dont waste your money on Chinese knockoffs. Spend the extra few dollars and buy the wilton.
customer_reviews.author: Dave scranton

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit. A vise for the price it's given at is pretty righteous. Heavy, strong, and well machined. I might add that is comes well greased. It's as if they dumped this vise into a pool of it but I can't complain! Some advise, watch your fingers, it will bite you. :P
customer_reviews.author: GPM

customer_reviews.title: Good vice for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that Wilton has gone to China for any of their vises but I guess it was necessary to get a product down to an everybody's priced range but so far so good. Works very well, is quite smooth operating and the jaws line up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wengler

customer_reviews.title: The parts I use with this vise requires quite a ...
customer_reviews.text: The parts I use with this vise requires quite a bit of torque. This has held up very well. I had a cast iron vise before this one and it broke after 1 day of use. This is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great vice. Not much to say except it works great and is sturdy as hell. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Vise
customer_reviews.text: Great small work vise! Strong and well made. Nice small mounting footprint, double swivel locks are a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Doc_Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my workshop. Glad I got it. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bench vise, with smooth finish and working. Quite a bit more substantial than I expected, with a lifetime warranty! Mounted easily to the top of my rolling tool cart.
customer_reviews.author: Don L. Binder

customer_reviews.title: Really is a nice home work bench vise and will do any small ...
customer_reviews.text: Really is a nice home work bench vise and will do any small or medium home repair requirement and serves well as a third hand.highly recommend this vise for the home workshop. Very good price also.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle wlesperCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good for squeezing stuff
customer_reviews.text: Only used a couple of times for putting on and taking off a muzzle break on my rifle. Spent $50 to have the gunsmith do it first, then thought I should spend $50 and do it my own damn self. Good vise.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Slusser

customer_reviews.title: Great vice, GREASY vice.
customer_reviews.text: If you decide to order this vice, have a roll of paper towels handy when you take it out of the box. I know the goal is to protect it from corrosion, but I'm docking a star because of how ridiculously greasy this arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: A quality product that showed up when they said it would. I would buy another one if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Harris Kohen

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: As a former tool and die maker, Wilton was the brand that we used in the tool room and they withstood a lot of abuse. The only drawback was the 4" jaw opening. 6" would have been much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I pictured, but seems sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.author: stevd

customer_reviews.title: a sturdy vice.
customer_reviews.text: no problems...a sturdy vice....a good price for the product... c
customer_reviews.author: chuck pearce

customer_reviews.title: Good vise, great warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Great little vise. It has about 120* of movement and heavy enough to handle decently sized objects. The lifetime warranty makes it more appealing than Home Depot vises comparatively priced.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Rische

customer_reviews.title: Small but strong!
customer_reviews.text: Kind of small. But that was my bad I guess for not doing research on size
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Valero

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Poor workmanship, not sturdy. Barely adequate for simple clamping jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Shade Tree Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect vice for DIY!
customer_reviews.text: Great vice! Holds everything very firm and does not slip. Has grooves to hold anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my workbench!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Solid, easy to manipulate... the anvil section can take a beating!
customer_reviews.author: EatMoreTacos

customer_reviews.title: good and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wish it swiveled further, good and sturdy, looks nice too
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Its a vise!
customer_reviews.text: Yup it sure is a vice. They basically dip it in oil before they send it to you, and it doesn't come with mounting hardware. But other than that, its a great vise that is super sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam.

customer_reviews.title: Nice vice, but a bit small in the width ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice vice, but a bit small in the width of the grip. Also, doesn't swivel as much as I would have hoped for. Otherwise, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: It is a good vise for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is a good vise for the money. Am pleased with it. I have not used it too long but fit and finish seem appropriate for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install on work bench
customer_reviews.text: Works as described -love the wide opening jaw and flat base. Easy to install on work bench.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Holds stuff good
customer_reviews.text: Mounted to toolbox. Put stuff in it. Beat stuff with hammer. Vice did not break. 10/10 Would buy again. Stuff I did not do with vice: - Press stuff with jaws. Better tools for this, such as hammer. - Use the anvil surface. Very small, wailing away with hammer might break vice.
customer_reviews.author: christopher m trevisiol

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vise for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy vise suitable for most light to medium tasks. Screw operates smoothly and rotation locks securely.
customer_reviews.author: Takla Makan

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD INEXPENSIVE DIY BENCH VISE
customer_reviews.text: My old 4 inch bench vise broke! This one is well made and will probably last for the rest of my life. I considered upgrading to the 5 inch model but, was scared away by the price (almost double).
customer_reviews.author: Albert B. Duckett

customer_reviews.title: ... turn rather than a half but otherwise it works great. The paint will chip off if dinged at ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish this thing did a full turn rather than a half but otherwise it works great. The paint will chip off if dinged at all and at random some of the metal has fallen off as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce R.

customer_reviews.title: Good vice for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small vice from a reputable company. Although it is made in china, it is still a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Silverstreak

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and strong
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and strong. A little stiff to begin with, but with use and a little grease, it performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great vice
customer_reviews.text: Small vice that performs like the larger more expensive one. Lifetime warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used for a few months worked good for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Fits great on a work bench
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on a work bench. Works even better!! The nice flat side even allows you to use it as a space to hammer small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: biojoe

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small home projects
customer_reviews.text: A step up from harbor freight but not a big step. Works great for small home projects. Made in China
customer_reviews.author: Cassie & Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: For light duty jobs it will handle just about anything. I have been using it to hold things in place while I saw them or bend them... for the average weekend jobs its plenty strong.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great and speedy
customer_reviews.text: Everything was just as said it would be. Fast delivery 📦
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Shobe

customer_reviews.title: Years of use, still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. A solid small vise perfect for the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little Vise. Not too large but hold very well and has a good weight
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It cracked on the anvil part as soon as my husband opened and used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lethcoe

customer_reviews.title: Wilton vice is great
customer_reviews.text: I finally got a vice for my garage. I went with a low end Wilton and so far so good. It came well oiled and seems very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Wallywoo

customer_reviews.title: but much better quality than anything else I have found for the ...
customer_reviews.text: May not be industrial grade, but much better quality than anything else I have found for the price. I recommend for the do it yourselfer.
customer_reviews.author: T Will

customer_reviews.title: Good vice for the money.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, a good value for a vice. If you have things that you need to stay put, you can probably use this to secure them. Crazy, right?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Base was smaller than expected had to order larger vise to work with hitch setup
customer_reviews.author: Calvin C Crewe III

customer_reviews.title: Quality Vise
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Well built tool. Exactly as described. A good addition to any DIY garage shop.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: great vice for my hobby bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vice. Made much better than the ones,at Harbor Frght.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Know that this is a very small vise carefully read ...
customer_reviews.text: Know that this is a very small vise carefully read dimensions. Still a solid vise, I just wish it was a tad bigger
customer_reviews.author: dylan miles

product_meta.description: Wilton 11104 Wilton Bench Vise, Jaw Width 4-Inch, Jaw Opening 4-Inch.
